text: After the death of Said bin Sultan, the empire was divided in what year and they practised what type of governmnent?
explanation: 1856 was when the empire was divided between among his sons into two sultanates. They practiced a monarchical system because they have a traditional ruler known as Said Bin Sultan.

text: The method that was used by the Europeans to control the admininstration of the Southern Nigeria was
explanation: Divide and Rule was used to control the Southern Nigeria by encouraging dissent among them, thereby preventing them from uniting in opposition.

text: The Ogboni cult in the Yoruba pre colonial Adminstration played the role of
explanation: The Ogboni is the third organ of government of the old Oyo empire. Among their functions is to check the excesses use of power by the Oyo mesi. It i also their duty to resolve cases between the Alaafin and the Oyo mesi.

text: Imperialism was adopted by Europeans to

options.A: develop the economies of the colonies
options.B: expand its economy and political base
options.C: establish a democratic society similar to that of Europe
options.D: end ethnic rivalry in the colonies

explanation: The Europeans colonized other countries (mostly African contries) to get economic resources to expand their economic and political tentacles.

text: The indirect rule system succeeded in Huasa/Fulani society because the
explanation: The Emirs were made use of in the adminsitration to control their society with their own already existing customs and traditions.

text: The system of government in the Benin pre colonial system of government is __________
explanation: The Benin were ruled by The Oba, monarch (traditional ruler) and political leader of the empire with absolute authority no one dares to challenge.

text: The most important conquest of Umar was that they establish the __________
explanation: Tijaniyah is an order of path originating in the Maghren but now wide spread into the Northern part of Sudan. One of Umar's achievement was establishing the Tijaniyah.

text: All of these are independent Hausa city states in Nigeria except
explanation: Daura is the second independent Hausa city states out of seven. The city states include: Biram, Daura, Kano, Katsina, Kano and Zaria.

text: The division of Sokoto caliphates into emirates is due to ________

options.A: the autocratic rule of Dan Fodio

explanation: It was divided into various emirates (emirates system) which each emirate will be headed by an Emir.

text: The Nationalist organization formed in Nigeria in the late 1930s was the

options.A: National Council of Nigeria and the Cameeroons

explanation: The NYM was the first nationalist movement with national colourization and it has some prominient members in it, the likes of Obafemi Awolowo, Ernest Ikoli etc

text: The Igbo's active resistance to British colonial rule is particaularly because of the

options.A: maladministration of the British indirect rule policy
options.D: impression that British officials favoured the Northers

explanation: The Igbos were living without a political head (acepherlous system), this was a great challenge for the British to use the imperial system.

text: Sierria Leone and Liberia were founded in what year _______ and _______ respectively
explanation: Liberia was founded by the Ameriacan colonhization society, a group of white Americans in the year 1824 while Sierria Leone by the committee for the relief of the black poor in the year 1787.

text: By the issuing the declaration of Independence, the then continental congress was changed to _____
explanation: On Sept. 9 1776, the Continental congress formally chnaged the name of their new Nation to the United Stares of America.

text: who was the greatest ruler in the Kanem Borno empire?
explanation: Mai Duanama Dibbalemi was the greatest king in Borno empire because he expanded the kingdom further North and Northeast into the desert.

text: The office of the prime minsiter was first created by the
explanation: The London Conference of 1957 with respect to the Nigeria Independence created the office of Head of Government to be referred to as Prime minister.

text: All of these except one are the motives of the Britain for colonizing Africa during the imperialism?
explanation: The Britain colonized the Africa not for social interest but economic interest especially

text: Which of the following formalized colonial penetration into Africa?
explanation: Berlin Conference of 1884/85 laid a strong foundation for colonial intervention in Africa.

text: The system the colonialists introduced in Nigeria to administer their function was regarded as?
explanation: Indirect rule is the system of administration adopted by the British colonial government which made use of the traditional rulers in ruling and controlling their colonies.

text: One of these is a regional language of the Omani Empire?
explanation: click here

text: Murtala Muhammed created 19 states out of ______ in he year
explanation: He created 19 states from the existing 12 states wich are Bauchi, Benue, Borno, Imo, Niger, Ogun, and Ondo.

text: Sierra Leone owes its name to the 15th century
explanation: Portuguese gave the name Sierra Leone (Lion Mountains) to the current Sierra Leone.

text: Most discovery in the Eastern and Western Era are usually within the ........ and ........

options.C: limpopo and the period of the primitives

explanation: Most discovery in the Eastern and Western Era are mostly from these two rivers

text: The first jihad in islam was launched in what year?
explanation: The First jihad was launched in 1804 by Sir Uthman Dan Fodio. It is also the holy way which led to the conquer of the Hausa Fulani empire.

text: The founder of the MAHDIA (MAHDIYA) MOVEMENT is?
explanation: Muhammed Ahmad is the founder of the MAHDIA (MAHDIYA) MOVEMENT because in June 1881 had widespread social and political as well as religious repercussion about the movement.

text: The political party that controlled the federal Governmnet during the second republic in Nigeria was the
explanation: National party of Nigeria won the presidential election in 1979, making Alhaji Aliyu Sheu Shagari emerged as the first Executive President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

text: Which administration favoured decoloniation as self-determination of African states.
explanation: Murtala/Obasanjo regime help the states to see through self determination and decolonization.

text: The Omani Empire vyed with ..... and ...... for trade
explanation: click here

text: whose administration favoured the decolonistion as self determination of African states
explanation: Murtala and Obadanjo regime helped the state to see through self determination and decolonization

text: All the following are reasons for military intervention in Nigeria except
explanation: Promoting of military officers is not part of the cause of intervention of military rule in Nigeria.

text: Educated elites did not like the system of indirect rule in Nigeria because it

options.D: did not make provision for them

explanation: The indirect rule did not make provision for the people instead traditional rulers was placed to control them

text: How many people died in the Mfecane war?
explanation: Mfecane, (Zulu: "The crushing"), Sotho Difaqane, series of Zulu and Nguni wars and forced migration of the second and third decades of the 19th century that changed the demographic, social, and political configuration of Southern and central Africa and parts of eastern Africa.It was recorded that over 1 to 2 million people died in the Mfecane war

text: The expanionist usually carry their claims from africa usually through a\an ,......
explanation: Hinterland is the land immediately next to, and inland from. It is the rural territory surrounding an urban area, a remote or underdeveloped area.

text: The history of Ethioipia in the 19th Century involve _______ number of fundamental process
explanation: The history of Ethioipia in the 19th Century involve three fundamental processes which are: (1) The Zamana Masaf∂nt (Era of Princess) and its coming to an end under Kassa Haylu, later Emperor Tawodros II (2) The repeated attempt by Egypt and Italy to colonize Ethiopia (3) M∂nilek' territorial expansion and conquest of what is now Southern Ethioipia.

text: Indirect rule was first practised in ______ before it was introduced to Nigeria.
explanation: The indirect rule system was practiced and successfully in India, before it got introduced to Nigeria by Lord Fredrick Luggard.

text: Sierra leone gained independence in?
explanation: The correct answer is 1961Sierria Leone gained her independence from the Great Britain in the yeart 1961

text: Nigeria became a member of OPEC since ___________
explanation: click here

text: How many years/Months/days did Murtala Muhammed spend in office and was assasinated by who?
explanation: Murtala Muhammed was assasinated in an abortive coup led by Lt. Colonel Dimka after spending 200days in office on 13th February, 1976

text: The first sets of imperialist who attempted to colonize Ethiopia were?
explanation: At the second stage of Ethiopia development, Italy tried several attempts to colonize Ethiopia but all were not successful.Till date Ethiopia remained an uncolonized country in Africa.

text: Which of the following party formed an alliance in the second republic?
explanation: Party alliance can be said to be when two or more political merged for the sake of election. The alliance between NPN and NPP was formed on 11th August 1979.

text: The Afrikaans Groot Trek, the migraton of some 12,000 to 14,000 Boers from cape colony in south Africa took place between ____ and ____
explanation: The Afrikaans Groot Trek, the migraton of some 12,000 to 14,000 Boers from cape colony in south Africa between 1835 and the early 1840s, in rebellion against the policies of the British government and in search of fresh pasturelands.

text: The Mahdiyya movement in Sudan was a fundamental reaction against
explanation: Khedwe Ismail of Egypt had attempted to suppress slave trade which would have devastating effect on Sudan's economy

text: The Nigeria colonial economy majorly depended on the exportation of _______
explanation: cocoa, palm produce and groundnut brought about 70% of total exportation in the Nigeria colonial economy.

text: Lyttleton significance in the political development of Nigeria was that, he ______

options.A: introduced the Federal system of governmnet

explanation: The 1954 constitution under the Governorship of Sir Oliver Lyttleton introduced Federalism to Nigeria.

text: The Ogiso dynasty in Benin failed due to ____

options.A: insufficient supply of arms and ammunition's

explanation: The major weakness which led to the tragic flaw of the Ogiso dynasty was the resentment and indifference attitude of the denizens towards the system that was regarded as an ill fated one.

text: The failure of the old Oyo empire was attributed to______
explanation: The internal and external aggression led to the fall of the empire in the late 18th century.

text: One of these is known to be the founding father of Nationalism in Nigeria?
explanation: The Radicalist; Sir Herbert Samuel Olayinka Macaulay was regarded as the father of Nigeria Nationalism who played vital roles in the political independence of Nigeria and a strong resistence to colonialism.

text: The amalgamation of the Northern and Southern protectorate of Nigeria took place on
explanation: Lord Fredrick Luggard amalgamated the Northern and the Southern protectorate of Nigeria on the 1st of January, 1914

text: The ______ presides over the Shariah Law court in the Sokoto Caliphate
explanation: The Alkali judgesd presides over the Shariah law and the Shariah law court.

text: Which of these is not an achievement under the colonial rule?
explanation: The correct answer is 'proclamation'.Proclamation is a direct rule from the Governor to the colony.

text: The quest for self government was a motion proposed by ______ in ______
explanation: On the floor of the House of Representative, Chief Anthony Enahoro a member of the Action Group moved a motion in 1953 that Nigeria should attain her self government in 1956 and this was in contrary to the opinion of the Northern leader, Sir Ahmadu Bello,

text: The formation of the first 12 states in Nigeria took place in the year?
explanation: Gen. Yakubu Gowon, on the 27th of May, 1967 created 12 states out of the existing four regions; Northern region, Western region, Eastern region and Mid Western region..

text: The Economic Commision of West African States (ECOWAS) has its adminsitrative headquarter in ______
explanation: The ECOWAS has two headquarters; the administrative headquarters in Abuja,Nigeria and Fund Headquarters in Lome,Togo

text: All of these but one is not part of the reasons why Europeans came to Nigeria?
explanation: The Europeans came to Africa to enhance, strengthened and spread their political and economic hegemony.

text: The Savannah region in Nigeria was characterized by _________
explanation: The Savannah region in Nigeria is highly vegetated.

text: Colonial resistance was triggered in Africa by
explanation: The coming of the educated elites who has seeked knowledge from different parts around the Globe projected great opposition to colonial rule in Africa.

text: The Royal Niger Company was playing as a a respect of _________ company
explanation: The Royal Niger Company which now Unilever was formerly known as 'The Goldjiers'

text: Obasanjo regime established a drafting committee in 1975 and it began work in _________
explanation: Gen. Olusegun Obasanjo military administration promised a transition to civil and he created a constitution drafting committee to see to the drafting of a new befitting constitution for Nigeria

text: The Jihad Uttsam Dan fodio launched in 1804 saw to the ___________ of Islam
explanation: The Jihad(holy war) of 1804 was in respect to Islam. The war is projected to the Kafiroons inhabiting the Hausa/Fulani empire.

text: The Mahdiyya movement was fundamental because __________

options.A: It was of the people's will
options.C: It was inflicted on the people
options.D: It was acknowledged by the constitution

explanation: The Mahidiyya movement has the back up of the Sudanese consititution.

text: The last ruler of the Oguso dynasty in the Benin Empire was
explanation: The Oguso dynasty of the Benin Empire was last ruled by Oba Owodo

text: When the pattern of Assimilation failed, the french colonialist resolved to ________
explanation: The term 'assimilation' means the absorption of new ideas into an existing cognitive structure.It is the imposition of a minority group the customs and attitudes of the dominant culture. The system does not give regards to the existing culture of the people. When the system later failed to hold in the French colonial territory, they switched to the 'Policy of Association'; a systems that gives regards to the life and culture of the people.

text: All these but one were not created in Abacha's region
explanation: Katsina was not among the additonal six states summing all total states to 36 by General Sanni Abacha in 1996

text: Who among the following never created a state?
explanation: General Thompson Johnson Umunakwe Aguyi Ironsi, the first military Head of State between January 16 1996 to July 29 1966. He never created any states.

text: Th leader of the South African's black consciousness movement (Steve Biko) died in _________
explanation: Steven Biko, the active leader of the Southern African's black consciousness and also a great resistance to the apartheid in South Africa died in the year 1977.

text: At Independence, which of the following national resources is the main stay of the Nigerian economy.?
explanation: The discovery of Oil in Oloibiri, Bayelsa state in 1956 made a quick U turn on the Economic sustainability from what it used to be to crude oil.

text: At the bide of Benin, the ethnic group that occupied the interland include __________
explanation: The Benin empire comprises The Edo, The Yoruba and The Urhobo.

text: The Alaafin of Oyo was remarkable assisted usually by _________
explanation: The Aremo who is the Crown prince, usually the oldest son of the Alaafin assists his father. He is a crown prince who can never succeed the Alaafin after his demise.

text: ECOWAS was found under whose leadership?
explanation: In Nigeria, Ecowas was founded under the leadership of Gen. Yakubu Gowon. It was officially formed by Yakubu Gowon and Gnasingbe Enyadema, the then President of Togo in 1975.

text: Abacha regime saw to the termination of _________
explanation: The General Sanni Abacha who was the minister of Defense in the Babangida Administration. His coup of 1994 toppled the administration of Gen. Ibrahim Babangida. Chief Ernest Shonekan was just an interim president (Head of State).

text: Which of the following is incorrect.?

options.A: Nigeria was removed at first from Common Wealth during Abacha's regime
options.B: Nigeria was at first bombarded in 1951

explanation: Sierria used to be a colonial terriotry of the Great Britain, She gained her independence in 1956.

text: Nigeria was then a conglomerations of _________
explanation: In the 18th century, the present day Nigeria was only a composition of various ethnic groups independent of their various territorial boundary without any form of bond or intersection

text: Regionalism was undisputably acknowledged and accredited to _________
explanation: Sir Arthur Richard in 1946 introduced Regionalism in Nigeria; Western. Northern and the Eastern Regions. He was also said to have laid foundation for Federalism.

text: The civil war between Yakubu Gowon and Odumegwu Ojukwu was mainly as a result of __________
explanation: The unhealthy rivalry between Gen Gowon and Major Gen. Ojukwu which resulted to the civil; war of 1967 to 1970 was as a result of the craving for power by Major Gen. Odumegwu Ojukwu

text: The last colonial governor general of Nigeria was_____________
explanation: The correct answer is James RobertsonThe last colonial governor of Nigeria before her independece was Sir James Robertson.

text: The Biafra civil war was between
explanation: The war lasted between August 1967 to January 1970 when Gen. Odumegwu Ojukwu had fled and his deputy Philip Effiong surrendered to the Federal Government authority.

text: The colonialist officially left Nigeria so as to enable her self government in__________
explanation: Nigeria became a full federal state in the year 1959. The colonialist left Nigeria for the sake of Independence in 1959

text: The people of Nupe mainly derive their source of livelihood from?
explanation: The people of Nupe sustain their livelihood majorly in fishing.

text: The Buhari/Idiagbo regime is popular known for his relentless advocacy of ________
explanation: The Gen. Muhammadu Buhari and Gen. Tunde Idiagbon military administration of 1983 - 1985 was popular for its movement of "war Against Indiscipline (WAI)".
